author: The Editorial Board
title: Racial-Profiling Rule Reversal
text:
The Senate on Wednesday voted 51-47 to kill the Consumer Financial Protection Bureauâ€™s auto-lending rule, which was as much a referendum on Democratic identity politics as lawless regulation.
Dodd-Frank explicitly prohibits the CFPB from regulating auto dealers. But former director Richard Cordray evaded the ban by regulating auto-financing as a way to dun dealers. He alleged dealers discriminated against minorities by charging them higher interest rates, though he had no proof since auto dealers are prohibited from collecting...
